38825213.review:
This game shaped my childhood when it first came out on the xbox 360. For years I've wanted to play it on the computer and have been keeping up to date on the progress since it got greenlit. 
Nostalgia aside, this game is constantly being updated and gets closer to perfection every time it does. To put you in perspective, this game was orginally a small world with an almost infinite supply of surprises beneath the ground. Now it's a full blown rpg. 
While on the surface it looks like another shameless minecraft rip off, I can safely say that this masterpiece never has felt or played like minecraft. Because of Craig's (The Creator) dedication to the game it achived much more than minecraft has through updates. Minecraft may have come first in creation, but there are many features that Total Miner had before minecraft, for example Duel Weilding, Ingame blocks used for scripting, Multiple types of stone, customized flatworlds, hightlimit reaching the 1000s, llamas/alpacas, a craft menu and ways to find new recepies, and more that I can't think of off the top of my head because of how different the games play. 
As well as features that minecraft eventually got after Total Miner, because this game doesn't need to keep that "minecrafty feel" that most devs who work on updating Minecraft often refer to, there are many features that make the world in Total Miner feel more real. These are things such as layers of rock the lower you get which you can't mine until you've gotten strong enough tools, an optional skill system that will unlock items so making the game feel more progressive, shops that you can use to buy and sell items, trees that come in all shapes and sizes, many role playing items that allow you to do things like fly, an insane amount of creatures that roam the world at night, making it almost impossible to survive without propper protection, marker blocks that you can use in creative which work like a sort of world edit to remove/build large areas quickly, I seriously can go on about the vastness of this game but instead I ask you to play it for yourself.
Right now it's very clearly in early access when you play, although for everything I've already said I truly belive that this game will soon be flawless.

38796076.review:
This is a great sandbox game, I'm not going to say it's bad because it's not. Sometimes the game does lag for the first minute when I load up my map, after that it is as smooth as a Glass ball.



The Survival is pretty fun, on easy mode you can enable shops for purchases, but if you're naturual then enable Normal mode for no shops, but if you're hardcore then enable Legendary for stronger enemies so you can see what real peril feels like. You can double jump if you want to reach higher spots, and can climb up the 3rd block if you time it right.

Digdeep is not in the game yet, but it's a mode where you find blueprints and wisdom scrolls so you don't start off with everything craftable. It's a very fun gamemode, also there are layers of hell.

Creative, you can use scripts to create easy to access shops with custom menus, create boss fights, advanced parkour levels, and many more. You can also save your best builds with a clipboard, also you can enable skills and finite for people in your map when multiplayer comes.

I think it's worth the money if you have no problem spending $10 on an indie game. I'm getting lots of play value from it, and if you like sandbox games with easy scripting then you'd like this.

38745992.review:
昔に箱○版でプレイした事がありましたが、それがsteamにリリースされたと聞き、いてもたってもいられずに購入しました。
※ちなみにこのレビューは、バージョンがv2.6.210(2017/12/28)、操作はキーボード、使用OSはWindows7 64bit版、このような環境でプレイしたものとなっています。いずれかの点に相違がある場合、レビュー通りの動作をしない可能性があります。

●どういったゲームなのか？
「total miner」は、サンドボックスゲーム、いわゆる「minecraft」のオマージュ作品です。そして本ゲームの主な目的は、『ただひたすら地下に掘り進む』という事です。
(正直、やったのがかなり昔のバージョン & 完全クリアはしていないので一概には言えませんが・・・)
「minecraft」だったら序盤に石のツルハシ１丁作って、あとはそれだけで岩盤まで簡単に辿り着けますが、「total miner」はそう簡単には行きません。まず、石ブロックの種類がとても多く、地下深くなるにつれて各々の石ブロックの硬度が高くなっていきます。当然、それでは序盤の石のツルハシで掘り進むには際限があると言う事です。そこで、掘り進める事ができるギリギリの地層に生成される石ブロックや鉱石で新たにツルハシを作り、更に地下深くを目指していく、というのが主体のゲームです。
もちろん、その石ブロックや鉱石が簡単に手に入るようなヤワなゲームではなく、モンスターや洞窟の崩落などのプレイヤーの採掘を阻むモノも存在し、作れるツルハシ・アイテムと言うのもとても数多く、やり応えは十分にあるゲームだと思います。

●いざプレイ！　・・・しかし (キーボードでは) 驚くほどの操作性の悪さ
期待を膨らませつついざプレイしようと思ったのですが、なぜかタイトル画面から抜け出せず・・・。 "Press any key" と表示されているのですが、何を入力しても受け付けてくれません。適当に色々入力してる内に気付きましたが、どうやらsteamのオーバーレイを表示させるとタイトルメニューに進めるようです。(デフォルトで、 Shift +  Tab キーを押して出てくる画面です)まあバグですよね。
そして次にオプションでFOVやマウス感度を設定しようとしましたが、なぜかいくらクリックしても目盛が動きません・・・。色々入力している内、どうやらキーボードの矢印キーだと設定できる事に気づきました。バグ。
最後にキーコンを設定しようとしましたが、クリックしてからキーを入力しても、何故か設定ができません・・・。おまけにキー設定の画面から抜けられなくなりました・・・。色々と入力しましたが、これだけはどうしようもなく、止む無く再起動を迫られました。重大なバグです。
・・・このように、正直、現バージョンではキーボードでまともにプレイする事が出来ないです。とくにオプション関連があまりに酷すぎだと思います。恐らく箱○コントローラでやれば何の問題が無いのでしょうか？レビューで不評が１つだけだったので、プレイ環境次第では通常にプレイできるモノなのだと思われます。

●結論
キーボードでプレイするなら、アップデートを待ちましょう。
箱○コントローラでやるなら、箱○でやりましょう。おしり。

38668589.review:
Why should you buy total miner as opposed to any other block crafting game? Simply because it's better. 

Total Miner is a game that originally came out on Xbox arcade, and sold quite a few copies. The game has your usual standard survival modes, creative modes, and it's very own skill system that carries across games. But where the game REALLY shines is in the creative potential of the players. 

In Total Miner you can copy/paste your builds, save them and bring them to other worlds, download other people's creations, flood fill and delete and all kinds of other creative tools built into the game itself. Hands down one of the best creative building toolsets in any of the block game genre. 

But it doesn't stop there, there's also a robust scripting system built into the game. Create moving platforms, secret doors, make a boss mob, create spawns, make your own hailstorm staff for players to get, make scripted dungeons the possibilites are endless. 

But wait, there's more. Craig has been working on creating a quest system for NPCs to actually talk to you and have things to say about quests in a dialogue tree. 

BUT WAIT, THERE'S EVEN MORE. With the unique pixel system you can create your own furniture and unique pixel decor.

I can't wait to see what the community does with this game.  Also ignore the lack of play time, I have hundreds of hours clocked into xbox version.

38668251.review:
Total Miner: Forge started out on the Xbox 360 to fill the Minecraft-shaped void in players' hearts before Minecraft Xbox 360 was released. Since then, it went on to become one of the best-selling games on the Xbox Live Indie Games service, which has since been shut down.

But in the modern gaming landscape... where is Total Miner's place? Most folks won't remember its legacy, and will likely bomb the game as a result. But I wouldn't say it deserves to be relegated to the piles of shovelware clones, because Total Miner [b]was[/b] a legitimate response to a need.

So who is this PC release for? Likely, fans of the original. It's an homage, a continuation, a preservation effort. To me, it's a love letter. To bygone days of my early teen years, spent in awe of the freedom this game allowed me, to the countless lost hours, to the formative effect it had on my interests. This game is to me what Minecraft was to people on the PC platform when it first hit it big.

But a lot of folks wouldn't know that by looking at it. It's lacking in animation. It's clunky, it's not very good looking. But it's robust, it's got layered progression, it's got that sense of adventure that it had back in 2012.

So where does the 2017 re-release of Total Miner belong in today's gaming landscape?

Easy.

My heart.

38606142.review:
This Review is based upon the polished version from the Xbox 360, and does NOT take into account any bugs or the lack of multiplayer in this current iteration of Total Miner Forge.  I played 2000+ hours on Xbox.
Total Miner Forge is one of my all-time favorite games, if not, my favorite.  
I’m not a big creative guy, but as far as I’ve played, the creative tools are powerful and easy to use, and the selection of blocks far surpass other games in the same genre.  
The primary adventure game types (survival or dig deep) have given me some of the most exhilarating experiences I’ve ever had in my life in gaming.  It sounds odd, since this is an indie game with pretty much just a single guy working on the thick of it.  But the music, the mechanics, and the late nights spent trying just to get to the next layer or rock layer all blended together to make a great experience.  
Dig Deep goes thousands of blocks down through harder and harder rock types and provide endless caves to explore and loot to find.  There’s also an economy system in the adventure game types, which sounded off-putting at first, but once I played it for a while, I felt that it was necessary.  It increases the pace of the adventure without compromising the feel of it.  You could return from your long days in the deep mines with a large haul of gold doubloons and gems.  It draws strong influences from Runescape, such as skills, an economy, and technology.  
In my opinion, however: 
If you’re a creative junky, this game is great alone and with friends.  
If you’re a survival junky, this game is not fun alone, but with friends, I can guarantee you will love it.  
It’s just my opinion, remember, take it with a grain of salt!

38605095.review:
I spent years waiting for this to come to PC, and I can say for the most part things were carried over nicely. But as of right now, there is no multiplayer, no deep dig, and I had a few bugs trying to get it running at 1080p as well. Some button prompts are still for the Xbox 360 controller, and because of this some features like the map is completely unusable. Still though, for what is here it is fun. In fact, the survival mode actually has far more features than the last time I played it. The new UI for the PC is quite nice, and it hints at built in mod support and scripts, which should make for some interesting multiplayer worlds once people far more creative than me get their hands on them. 

Now, people may ask: "Why should I play this when I have minecraft?"

Well, the simple answer is this game isn't much like minecraft outside of creative. As Fortress Craft Evolved is automation machine management simulator in the vein of Factorio, Total Miner is an exploration game in the vein of Terraria. While the gamplay is inarguably not as smooth as either Minecraft, the game simply has a lot going for it to make up for that. A real sense of progression, a market economy shop system, skill progression, and much, much more. If you want to simply write this off as a Minecraft clone that's fine, but you'd only be doing yourself a diservice by ignoring what I'm sure, once complete, will be a fantastic experience. 

As of now though, I would say unless you're a hardcore fan wait a few months until the game is feature and bug complete to pick it up.

This Xbox 360 indie game classic has been one of my favorites. I've played this game since the  year it debuted in 2011 and seen it grow along with other fellow players. So obviously I'm just as excited for a PC release since the indie games program/support on Xbox 360 has ended not too long ago.
Total Miner pretty much has almost all base features besides mutiplayer or digdeep mode, but other than that it feels just as I played it on the 360 except that it runs a lot more better.

Here's what to expect performance wise
-Super fast loading times
-GLORIOUS FPS
-MOAR PARTICLES
-Wayyyyyy shorter waiting time for land/buildings to pop in
-Smooth scripting performance
-Higher resolution support

Also the new menu design is pretty neat, it's nice to have items all organized. For the veterans who love the old menu style, yes there's an option for that thankfully.

All in all Total Miner is a decent indie game that I'd recommend for those who are looking to bring out their imagination and create complex worlds in voxel form. With many customization options, scripting capabillities, a variety of items, and powerful creative tools, you can create fantastic worlds whether it'd be an RPG, horror map, art showcase, massive cities, challenges etc.

38571488.review:
Total Miner: (Forge) 
12/23/2017

Total Miner has been an original Xbox Live Indie Game since 2011, and has actually been around from before Minecraft was released for the consoles, starting with the Xbox 360.

At $3, this was the second highest rated XBLIG Title of All time, and they even discounted it on Release week when it coincided with the Steam Winter Sale.

Total Miner is overall a very good game in itself, if you enjoy RPG's, simplistic graphics, Minecraft type games such as Terraria or others, and it does well on making its own mark.

With a different art style, its own texture packs built in (which was a difference from Console Minecraft at the time),
interesting dual wielding features 
(which are significantly better then the way Minecraft is trying to introduce it as of the later updates)
and the concept of collecting item Blueprints in the Dig Deep mode to get as deep as possible, along with all the player models, earned skins through Achievements in game, other ores and mobs and Obsidian teleporters, just stuff that made Total Miner stand out differently from not only Minecraft but all the other awful 
Minecraft type games that were coming out to leech on the success, such as Castleminer and all that nonsense.

This game was my childhood, I got it when it came out on Xbox 360 when I had such a weak early 2000's PC, that it couldn't run Minecraft above 10fps, and to this day I'll still play it.

(In case anyone is wondering on release day, Dig Deep Mode is not Available yet
Multiplayer will be added later on
and to get 1080p Fullscreen you must go in game first, then turn it all on in Graphics settings)

TL;DR
If you like Minecraft-style games, Indie games, don't want to spend full price on MC, knew about this game or XBLIG before and/or just like the fact that its run through Steam, I recommend buying this game.

Happy Mining

It also looks to offer a lot of cool things you just can't build in Minecraft without a bunch of mods installed.

But here is the reasons to buy it..
1) It's 1/3rd the price of Minecraft
2) It's on Steam which means when it goes online multiplayer you'll have all of Steams friend features linked to this game
3) Mod support and the ability to script your own mini games, bosses, and content is VERY tasty!
4) Enemies spawn at night, and each have their own enemies, watch different creatures fight each other and then you can sneak up and take out the injured winner!  Super cool!
5) It runs well and has a TON of options and features even its first hour of early access launch

Here are some reasons to hold off..
1) It doesn't yet support online or co-op play of any kind at early access launch
2) It may not be original enough to even support your $10, especially if you already own Minecraft

All in all though, it looks like a great new Minecraft for Steam and seems to run very well with my first quick play test.  I can't see any reason why this wouldn't be well worth its price tag to any fan of these kinda games.

Highly recommended, the price is amazing for what it looks to offer.

38568050.review: I've played this game since it was an indie game back on the Xbox 360, back before even that version had multiplayer. I originally played it because it was the only console version of Minecraft that was any good at the time. Over time it evolved into more than just a minecraft clone, but into a game where you can make your own games if you wanted to. It's a fantastic game, and it's not a minecraft clone anymore. 38568006.review:
Total Miner was one of the best games on the 360 by far. Which considering it was an indie game costing less than £2/$3 is an amazing feat by itself. Now I get to enjoy it in all its glory on the PC. Without the hardware limitations of the 360 or the restrictions placed on indie games by XBLIG. The developer/s are always listening and open to any ideas which may improve the game and the community is one of the best i've had the pleasure of belonging to.

The survival mode on it's own is a match for any voxel based game available with plenty to do and get killed by. The creative mode with its markers & script based system far surpasses any other voxel based game and the dig deep mode brings something completely new to the whole genre.

If you are a fan of the voxel based genre yet yearn for something different, then this is the game for you. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this game to anyone and i'm looking forward to all the updates to come.

Really amazing game, brings back a lot of childhood memories from playing this on the Xbox 360. Knowing the fact that it is an early access game, it is off to a bit of a rocky start, and that's okay, it is an overall nice game, but there are a few things I would consider adding in or keep from the 360 version.

-Keep in the old menu, It's nice and it suits it more than the newer one, I got confused pretty fast with it.
-With the menu, maybe consider adding in a mouse sensitivity option. When I was playing it was a little harder to navigate because the mouse was either too fast or too slow.
-I don't know if this is just me, but when I entered the game, I saw no option to put the game itself on fullscreen.
-This may be in a future update, but the red dots on the compass bar on the top was really nice, maybe add that in.
-Keep the character unlocking thing were you need to do specific tasks to unlock those characters.
-I can't wait for Dig Deep, that was one of my favorite gamemodes in Total Miner Forge.
-Maybe add in a way to collect crafted materials faster, trying to get wood planks from 50+ wood is slow and can get annoying pretty fast.
-Multiplayer should be a MUST. So many people loved multiplayer on the Xbox 360 version, including me, so I HIGHLY RECOMMEND adding it in the future.

Overall, this game is really great, but considering the amount of bugs that they still need to work on, I would consider waiting to purchase it until it's in a more stable state, but for bringing back so many childhood memories, It's worth the purchase. 10/10 Studio Forge, You guys are doing great!

38999473.review:
I have followed this game since it was on the XBL indie game market and I am proud to see how much it has grown since then. 

------------THIS GAME IS NOT A MINECRAFT CLONE DESPITE WHAT PEOPLE THINK------------

yes it maybe a block based sandbox like minecraft but it is far from it, TotalMiner has its own XP system where you have to do certain tasks in order to level up strength, stamina, and many other abilities. Failing to do so will not allow you to progress in the game with the XP system active. They also have the basic survial and creative modes that other block based games have, so you are probably thinking "why should i purchase this game if its only selling point is a XP system?"

well the XP system is only the tip of the iceberg my friend, TotalMiner has its own unique mode (ON THE WAY SHORTLY) called DigDeep. Dig Deep mode is kind of like your standard block game but with a twist. You have to mine the earth layer by layer finding certain ores to progress to the next layer and also discover blueprints to get better equipment

Overall I Highly Recommend this game to anybody looking for a casual cheap infinte adventure. With a price tag of $9.99 the game is worth a buy 

AS OF 01/02/2018 ONLINE MULTIPLAYER IS NOT IMPLIMENTED BUT THE DEV IS GOING TO ADD IT EVENTUALLY

(Please Note that I am not saying this to label the game, I am just saying what it feels like to play it from my POV) Total Miner is a much like Minecraft, but in my opinion, BETTER! It still has some tweaks to fix and potential, but I do believe this game can become something amazing. I see this game linking with the Consle players so the community isn't seperated by PC and Consle people.

Creative mode can let a person expand on not only creativity, but scripts and coding. This can make for an excellent way to build adventure worlds, or interactive worlds.

Survival can give a very different experiance. If you enable skills, it gives that vibe that Skyrim and Minecraft had a baby. Disabling skills can give a smooth normal survival feel and make players rely on items they craft and find with their own skills.

The items span very far and give a unique feel to the game as you aren't limited to just Iron and Diamonds. You can play defensively, offensively, or ranged.

The mobs are intresting. Each of them having their own levels. All of them spawn if skills are disabled. Enabling skills can make the mobs scale with you in level, making it so you won't die by a diablo on your first night.

All in all, 10/10 IGN and I r8 8/8 m8! Can't wait to see what the full version has in store!
